result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan A Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
FIRST 6 MONTHS:  Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  SECOND 6 MONTHS:  Same Huber privileges PLUS Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Random urine screens.  No positive results. No illegal drugs. Maintain absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without valid prescription. No contact with drug community.
Seek and maintain full time employment. Obtain high school diploma or GED. Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done. Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

timeConds.notes: STAYED. Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment. To be used by agent for violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan A Rodriguez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juan A Rodriguez in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: alp    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4
days time served, FIRST 6 MONTHS:  Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  SECOND 6 MONTHS:  Same Huber privileges PLUS Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months with the following conditions:
*Court imposed but STAYED 60 days condition time in the HOC (Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment) to be used by agent for violations.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Juan A Rodriguez in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-31-2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Juan A Rodriguez in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for Hanna Kolberg for the State of Wisconsin. Case is rescheduled for a Projected Guilty Plea and Sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Juan A Rodriguez in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Juan A Rodriguez in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  William Berens, student intern under the supervision of Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/25/14.

14RM015502  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 03-17-2014

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Juan A Rodriguez in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Juan A Rodriguez in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
